result.execSummary:
The defendant Dieter P Spudat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid in full by 05-01-2015 as a condition of probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dieter P Spudat

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Various documents in support of defendant for his sentencing filed by Attorney Fay.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dieter P Spudat in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.

State moves to amend count 1 from a Felony to a Misdemeanor; and filed an amended information.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor without a valid license.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge: Court Waives.
To be paid in full by:  05/01/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Dieter P Spudat in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
filed by defendant advising court of new telephone number.
Preliminary hearing on January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Dieter P Spudat in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.   Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Jury Demand filed by Attorney Fay.
Initial appearance on December 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Daniel P Fay in court.   Defendant Dieter P Spudat did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is ill and Atty. Fay requests an adjournment. State has no objection.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
